trans-unit.target: Així hem salvat ell i aquells amb ell per misericòrdia de nosaltres. I hem eliminat els que negaven rètols, i no eren [gens] creients.

trans-unit.source: And to the Thamud [We sent] their brother Salih. He said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. There has come to you clear evidence from your Lord. This is the she-camel of Allah [sent] to you as a sign. So leave her to eat within Allah 's land and do not touch her with harm, lest there seize you a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: I a la Thamud [hem enviat] seu germà Salih. Va dir, "O poble meu, venerar Allah; teniu cap deïtat diferent d'ell. Hi ha arribat a aclarir l'evidència del seu Senyor. Aquest és el camell ell d'Allah [enviar] a vostè com un senyal. Així que deixin de menjar dins terra de Allah i no tocar-la amb mal, perquè no hi ha aprofitar un dolor càstig.

trans-unit.source: And remember when He made you successors after the 'Aad and settled you in the land, [and] you take for yourselves palaces from its plains and carve from the mountains, homes. Then remember the favors of Allah and do not commit abuse on the earth, spreading corruption."
trans-unit.target: I recordeu que quan vostè va fer seus successors després l ' Aad i es van establir a la terra, [i] vostè prendre per a si mateixos palaus de les planes i tallar de les muntanyes, cases. Llavors recorda els favors d'Allah i no cometre abusos a la terra, divulgació corrupció".

trans-unit.source: Said the eminent ones who were arrogant among his people to those who were oppressed - to those who believed among them, "Do you [actually] know that Salih is sent from his Lord?" They said, "Indeed we, in that with which he was sent, are believers."
trans-unit.target: Dir els eminents que eren arrogants entre la seva gent a aquells que estaven oprimits - a qui considerava [entre ells, "en] saps que Salih és enviat del seu senyor?" Deien, "De fet, que amb el qual va ser enviat, som creients."

trans-unit.source: Said those who were arrogant, "Indeed we, in that which you have believed, are disbelievers."
trans-unit.target: Va dir que els que eren arrogants, "Fet que, en la qual s'han cregut, són disbelievers."

trans-unit.source: So they hamstrung the she-camel and were insolent toward the command of their Lord and said, "O Salih, bring us what you promise us, if you should be of the messengers."
trans-unit.target: Per tal que hamstrung el camell i que van ser insolent cap a l'ordre del seu Senyor i va dir: «O Salih, acostar-nos què us comprometeu a nosaltres, si hauria de ser dels missatgers. "

trans-unit.source: So the earthquake seized them, and they became within their home [corpses] fallen prone.
trans-unit.target: Així el terratrèmol agafat, i esdevingueren dins casa [cadàvers] caigut propensa.

trans-unit.source: And he turned away from them and said, "O my people, I had certainly conveyed to you the message of my Lord and advised you, but you do not like advisors."
trans-unit.target: I ell va deixar-los i va dir: «O poble meu, certament havia transmès a el missatge del meu Senyor i t'aconsella, però no et agrada assessors. "

trans-unit.source: And [We had sent] Lot when he said to his people, "Do you commit such immorality as no one has preceded you with from among the worlds?
trans-unit.target: I [ens havia enviat] molt quan va dir al seu poble, "fer cometre tal immoralitat com ningú li ha precedit entre els mons?

trans-unit.source: Indeed, you approach men with desire, instead of women. Rather, you are a transgressing people."
trans-unit.target: De fet, t'acostes a homes amb desig, en lloc de les dones. Més aviat, és un poble transgressores."

trans-unit.source: But the answer of his people was only that they said, "Evict them from your city! Indeed, they are men who keep themselves pure."
trans-unit.target: Però la resposta del seu poble va ser només que deien, "expulsar-los de la teva ciutat! De fet, són els homes que mantenir-se pur."

trans-unit.source: So We saved him and his family, except for his wife; she was of those who remained [with the evildoers].
trans-unit.target: Així que som estalvis ell i la seva família, excepte la seva dona; va ser dels que va romandre [amb l'evildoers].

trans-unit.source: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones]. Then see how was the end of the criminals.
trans-unit.target: I ens ha plogut sobre ells una pluja [de pedres]. Després de veure com era el final dels criminals.

trans-unit.source: And to [the people of] Madyan [We sent] their brother Shu'ayb. He said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. There has come to you clear evidence from your Lord. So fulfill the measure and weight and do not deprive people of their due and cause not corruption upon the earth after its reformation. That is better for you, if you should be believers.
trans-unit.target: I [la gent del] Madyan [hem enviat] seu germà Shu'ayb. Va dir, "O poble meu, venerar Allah; teniu cap deïtat diferent d'ell. Hi ha arribat a aclarir l'evidència del seu Senyor. Així complir la mesura i pes i no privar a la gent de la seva causa i provocar no corrupció en la terra després de la seva reforma. Que és millor per a vostè, si vostè ha de ser creients.

trans-unit.source: And do not sit on every path, threatening and averting from the way of Allah those who believe in Him, seeking to make it [seem] deviant. And remember when you were few and He increased you. And see how was the end of the corrupters.
trans-unit.target: I no seure cada camí amenaçant i evitar de la manera d'Allah els que creuen en ell, tractant de fer-ho [semblar] anormals. I recordes quan et van ser poques i va augmentat vostè. I veure com va ser el final de la corrupters.

trans-unit.source: And if there should be a group among you who has believed in that with which I have been sent and a group that has not believed, then be patient until Allah judges between us. And He is the best of judges."
trans-unit.target: I si hi ha de ser un grup entre vosaltres qui ha cregut que amb el qual he estat enviat i un grup que no ha cregut, llavors ser pacient fins a jutges Allah entre nosaltres. I és el millor dels jutges."

trans-unit.source: Said the eminent ones who were arrogant among his people, "We will surely evict you, O Shu'ayb, and those who have believed with you from our city, or you must return to our religion." He said, "Even if we were unwilling?"
trans-unit.target: Dir els eminents que eren arrogants entre la seva gent, "segurament es expulsió vostè, O Shu'ayb i els que han cregut amb tu de nostra ciutat, o hem de tornar a la nostra religió". Va dir, "fins i tot si ens estaven disposats?"

trans-unit.source: We would have invented against Allah a lie if we returned to your religion after Allah had saved us from it. And it is not for us to return to it except that Allah, our Lord, should will. Our Lord has encompassed all things in knowledge. Upon Allah we have relied. Our Lord, decide between us and our people in truth, and You are the best of those who give decision."
trans-unit.target: Ens hauria inventat contra Allah una mentida si hem retornat a la seva religió després Allah ens havia salvat d'ella. I no és per a nosaltres retornar-ho llevat que Allah, nostre Senyor, ha es. Nostre Senyor ha abasta totes les coses en el coneixement. A Allah ens han confiat. Nostre Senyor, decidir entre nosaltres i la nostra gent en veritat, i són els millors dels que donen decisió."

trans-unit.source: Said the eminent ones who disbelieved among his people, "If you should follow Shu'ayb, indeed, you would then be losers."
trans-unit.target: Dir els eminents que dubtaven entre la seva gent, "Si vostè ha de seguir Shu'ayb, en efecte, llavors seria perdedors."

trans-unit.source: So the earthquake seized them, and they became within their home [corpses] fallen prone.
trans-unit.target: Així el terratrèmol agafat, i esdevingueren dins casa [cadàvers] caigut propensa.

trans-unit.source: Those who denied Shu'ayb - it was as though they had never resided there. Those who denied Shu'ayb - it was they who were the losers.
trans-unit.target: Qui nega la Shu'ayb - era com si mai no hi havia residit allà. Qui nega Shu'ayb - van ser ells qui van ser els perdedors.

trans-unit.source: And he turned away from them and said, "O my people, I had certainly conveyed to you the messages of my Lord and advised you, so how could I grieve for a disbelieving people?"
trans-unit.target: I ell va deixar-los i va dir: «O poble meu, certament havia transmès a els missatges del meu Senyor i aconsella que, llavors, com podria et angoixa per un poble incrèdul? "

trans-unit.source: And We sent to no city a prophet [who was denied] except that We seized its people with poverty and hardship that they might humble themselves [to Allah].
trans-unit.target: Hem enviat a cap ciutat un profeta [que s'ha denegat] excepte que hem agafat les persones amb una pobresa i penúria que es podria humiliï [a Allah].

trans-unit.source: Then We exchanged in place of the bad [condition], good, until they increased [and prospered] and said, "Our fathers [also] were touched with hardship and ease." So We seized them suddenly while they did not perceive.
trans-unit.target: Llavors hem intercanviat en el dolent [condició], bé, fins que va augmentar [i va prosperar] i va dir: "nostres pares [també] eren tocats amb dificultats i facilitat". Així que hem agafat de sobte mentre ells no perceben.

trans-unit.source: And if only the people of the cities had believed and feared Allah, We would have opened upon them blessings from the heaven and the earth; but they denied [the messengers], so We seized them for what they were earning."
trans-unit.target: I si només la gent de les ciutats havia cregut i temut Allah, ens han obert a les benediccions del cel i la terra; però es va negar [missatgers], així que hem agafat per què ells van guanyar".

trans-unit.source: Then, did the people of the cities feel secure from Our punishment coming to them at night while they were asleep?
trans-unit.target: Llavors, la gent de les ciutats sentia segur d'un càstig venen a ells a la nit mentre eren adormits?

trans-unit.source: Or did the people of the cities feel secure from Our punishment coming to them in the morning while they were at play?
trans-unit.target: O la gent de les ciutats sentia segur d'un càstig venen a ells al matí mentre que estaven en joc?

trans-unit.source: Then did they feel secure from the plan of Allah? But no one feels secure from the plan of Allah except the losing people.
trans-unit.target: Llavors senten segurs des del pla d'Allah? Però ningú se sent segur des del pla d'Allah excepte el poble perdent.

trans-unit.source: Has it not become clear to those who inherited the earth after its [previous] people that if We willed, We could afflict them for their sins? But We seal over their hearts so they do not hear.
trans-unit.target: Això no esdevé clar a qui va heretar la terra després de la seva gent [anterior] que si hem volgut, hem pogut afecten-los pels seus pecats? Però vam segellar sobre les seves ànimes perquè no senten.

trans-unit.source: Those cities - We relate to you, [O Muhammad], some of their news. And certainly did their messengers come to them with clear proofs, but they were not to believe in that which they had denied before. Thus does Allah seal over the hearts of the disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Aquelles ciutats - ens relacionem amb tu, [O Muhammad], algunes de les seves notícies. I sens dubte els seus missatgers venia a ells amb proves clares, però no es creu en el que s'havia negat abans. Així Allah segell sobre els cors dels disbelievers.

trans-unit.source: And We did not find for most of them any covenant; but indeed, We found most of them defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: I no trobàvem per a la majoria d'ells qualsevol Pacte; però de fet, vam trobar la majoria d'ells desafiant desobedient.

trans-unit.source: Then We sent after them Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his establishment, but they were unjust toward them. So see how was the end of the corrupters.
trans-unit.target: Llavors hem enviat després d'ells Moses amb rètols faraó i el seu establiment, però eren injustes cap a ells. Així que veure com era el final de la corrupters.

trans-unit.source: And Moses said, "O Pharaoh, I am a messenger from the Lord of the worlds
trans-unit.target: I Moses va dir, "faraó O sóc un Missatger del Senyor dels mons

trans-unit.source: [Who is] obligated not to say about Allah except the truth. I have come to you with clear evidence from your Lord, so send with me the Children of Israel."
trans-unit.target: [Qui és] obligat a no diuen sobre Allah excepte la veritat. He arribat a vostè amb evidència clara del seu Senyor, així enviar amb mi nens d'Israel."

trans-unit.source: [Pharaoh] said, "If you have come with a sign, then bring it forth, if you should be of the truthful."
trans-unit.target: [Faraó] dit, "si vostè haver vingut amb un signe, llavors portar-lo endavant, si hauria de ser de la veritat."

trans-unit.source: So Moses threw his staff, and suddenly it was a serpent, manifest.
trans-unit.target: Moses va llançar el seu personal, i de sobte era una serp, manifestar.

trans-unit.source: And he drew out his hand; thereupon it was white [with radiance] for the observers.
trans-unit.target: I dibuixà amb la mà; llavors era blanc [amb radiància] pels observadors.

trans-unit.source: Said the eminent among the people of Pharaoh, "Indeed, this is a learned magician
trans-unit.target: Va dir el eminents entre la gent del faraó, "de fet, aquest és un mag après

trans-unit.source: Who wants to expel you from your land [through magic], so what do you instruct?"
trans-unit.target: Qui vol expulsar des de la terra [a través de la màgia], així que què et instruir? "

trans-unit.source: They said, "Postpone [the matter of] him and his brother and send among the cities gatherers
trans-unit.target: Deien, "ajornar [la qüestió de] ell i el seu germà i enviar entre els recol·lectors de ciutats

trans-unit.source: Who will bring you every learned magician."
trans-unit.target: Que portarà cada mag après."

trans-unit.source: And the magicians came to Pharaoh. They said, "Indeed for us is a reward if we are the predominant."
trans-unit.target: I els mags van arribar a faraó. Deien, "fet per a nosaltres és una recompensa si som els predominants."

trans-unit.source: He said, "Yes, and, [moreover], you will be among those made near [to me]."
trans-unit.target: Va dir: "Sí i, [a més], seràs entre els fets a prop [per mi]."

trans-unit.source: They said, "O Moses, either you throw [your staff], or we will be the ones to throw [first]."
trans-unit.target: Deien, "O Moses, tira [el seu personal], o serem els llançar [primer]."

trans-unit.source: He said, "Throw," and when they threw, they bewitched the eyes of the people and struck terror into them, and they presented a great [feat of] magic.
trans-unit.target: Va dir, "Llençar" i quan es llançava, es Embrujada els ulls de la gent i colpejat terror en ells, i van presentar una màgia gran [gesta de].

trans-unit.source: And We inspired to Moses, "Throw your staff," and at once it devoured what they were falsifying.
trans-unit.target: I ens va inspirar a Moses, "Tira el seu personal," i a la vegada es devorat el que ells van falsificar.

trans-unit.source: So the truth was established, and abolished was what they were doing.
trans-unit.target: Perquè la veritat es va establir i va abolir era el que estaven fent.

trans-unit.source: And Pharaoh and his people were overcome right there and became debased.
trans-unit.target: I el faraó i la seva gent van superar allà mateix i va ser degradat.

trans-unit.source: And the magicians fell down in prostration [to Allah].
trans-unit.target: I els mags va caure en la prostració [a Allah].

trans-unit.source: They said, "We have believed in the Lord of the worlds,
trans-unit.target: Deien, "hem cregut en el Senyor dels mons,

trans-unit.source: The Lord of Moses and Aaron."
trans-unit.target: El Senyor de Moses i Aaron".

trans-unit.source: Said Pharaoh, "You believed in him before I gave you permission. Indeed, this is a conspiracy which you conspired in the city to expel therefrom its people. But you are going to know.
trans-unit.target: Deien faraó, "creien en ell abans que li va donar el permís. De fet, això és una conspiració que es van conspirar en la ciutat per expulsar dels mateixos la seva gent. Però vas a saber.

trans-unit.source: I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides; then I will surely crucify you all."
trans-unit.target: Segurament va tallar les mans i els peus en costats oposats; llavors jo es segurament crucificar tots."

trans-unit.source: They said, "Indeed, to our Lord we will return.
trans-unit.target: Deien, "de fet, a nostre Senyor tornarem.

trans-unit.source: And you do not resent us except because we believed in the signs of our Lord when they came to us. Our Lord, pour upon us patience and let us die as Muslims [in submission to You]."
trans-unit.target: I no molesta ens excepte perquè hem cregut en els signes del nostre Senyor, quan van arribar a nosaltres. Nostre Senyor, aboqui sobre nosaltres paciència i morir-nos com musulmans [en el submissió a vostè]."

trans-unit.source: And the eminent among the people of Pharaoh said," Will you leave Moses and his people to cause corruption in the land and abandon you and your gods?" [Pharaoh] said, "We will kill their sons and keep their women alive; and indeed, we are subjugators over them."
trans-unit.target: I els eminents entre la gent del faraó va dir,"deixarà Moses i la seva gent per provocar corrupció en la terra i abandonar vostè i els seus déus?" [Faraó] dit, "es matar els seus fills i mantenir les seves dones viu; i de fet, estem subjugators sobre ells."

trans-unit.source: Said Moses to his people, "Seek help through Allah and be patient. Indeed, the earth belongs to Allah. He causes to inherit it whom He wills of His servants. And the [best] outcome is for the righteous."
trans-unit.target: Moses va dir a la seva gent, "buscar ajuda a través d'Allah, i ser pacient. De fet, la terra pertany a Allah. Provoca heretaran qui ell voluntats dels seus servents. I el resultat [millor] és per al recte.

trans-unit.source: They said, "We have been harmed before you came to us and after you have come to us." He said, "Perhaps your Lord will destroy your enemy and grant you succession in the land and see how you will do."
trans-unit.target: Deien, "Que han estat perjudicats abans que vingués a nosaltres i després que han arribat a nosaltres." Va dir, "Potser el Senyor es destruir el seu enemic i concedeix la successió en la terra i veure com ho faràs".

trans-unit.source: And We certainly seized the people of Pharaoh with years of famine and a deficiency in fruits that perhaps they would be reminded.
trans-unit.target: I certament hem agafat la gent del faraó amb anys de fam i deficiència de fruites que potser vols recordar.

trans-unit.source: But when good came to them, they said, "This is ours [by right]." And if a bad [condition] struck them, they saw an evil omen in Moses and those with him. Unquestionably, their fortune is with Allah, but most of them do not know.
trans-unit.target: Però quan va bé arribar a ells, deien, "aquest és el nostre [de dret]." I si un mal [condició] colpejat, van veure un mal averany de Moses i aquells amb ell. Sens dubte, la fortuna és amb Allah, però la majoria d'ells no saben.

trans-unit.source: And they said, "No matter what sign you bring us with which to bewitch us, we will not be believers in you."
trans-unit.target: I van dir, "no importa quin signe que ens amb què retocades ens porten, no serem creients en tu."

trans-unit.source: So We sent upon them the flood and locusts and lice and frogs and blood as distinct signs, but they were arrogant and were a criminal people.
trans-unit.target: Així hem enviat sobre ells la inundació i llagostes i els polls i granotes i sang com signes diferents, però van ser arrogants i eren un poble criminal.

trans-unit.source: And when the punishment descended upon them, they said, "O Moses, invoke for us your Lord by what He has promised you. If you [can] remove the punishment from us, we will surely believe you, and we will send with you the Children of Israel."
trans-unit.target: I quan el càstig descendia sobre ells, deien, "O Moses, invocar per a nosaltres el seu Senyor pel que ell ha promès. Si [poden] suprimir el càstig de nosaltres, segurament creurà vostè, i li enviarem amb vosaltres nens d'Israel."

trans-unit.source: But when We removed the punishment from them until a term which they were to reach, then at once they broke their word.
trans-unit.target: Però quan retirem el càstig d'ells fins a un terme que van arribar a, llavors a la vegada es van separar la paraula.

trans-unit.source: So We took retribution from them, and We drowned them in the sea because they denied Our signs and were heedless of them.
trans-unit.target: Així que prenem la retribució d'ells, i ells ofegat en el mar perquè nega rètols i sense fer cas d'ells van ser.

trans-unit.source: And We caused the people who had been oppressed to inherit the eastern regions of the land and the western ones, which We had blessed. And the good word of your Lord was fulfilled for the Children of Israel because of what they had patiently endured. And We destroyed [all] that Pharaoh and his people were producing and what they had been building.
trans-unit.target: I ens va causar la gent que havia estat oprimits d'heretar el fynbos oriental de la terra i els occidentals, que havíem beneït. I la bona paraula del teu senyor es va complir per a nens d'Israel per què havia suportat pacientment. I hem destruït [tots els] aquell faraó i la seva gent es van produir i el que havia estat construint.

trans-unit.source: And We took the Children of Israel across the sea; then they came upon a people intent in devotion to [some] idols of theirs. They said, "O Moses, make for us a god just as they have gods." He said, "Indeed, you are a people behaving ignorantly.
trans-unit.target: I prenem nens d'Israel a través del mar; llavors van arribar a una intenció de gent de devoció [alguns] ídols d'ells. Deien, "O Moses, fan per a nosaltres un Déu només mentre tenen déus." Va dir, "de fet, són un poble comportant ignorància.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those [worshippers] - destroyed is that in which they are [engaged], and worthless is whatever they were doing."
trans-unit.target: De fet, aquells [adoradors] - destruït és que en què estan [participen], i és inútil el que estaven fent. "

trans-unit.source: He said, "Is it other than Allah I should desire for you as a god while He has preferred you over the worlds?"
trans-unit.target: Va dir, "És que no sigui Allah que ha desig per a tu com un Déu mentre ell ha preferit sobre els mons?"

trans-unit.source: And [recall, O Children of Israel], when We saved you from the people of Pharaoh, [who were] afflicting you with the worst torment - killing your sons and keeping your women alive. And in that was a great trial from your Lord.
trans-unit.target: I [desvetllen, O fills d'Israel], quan som estalvis des de la gent del faraó, [que] que afecten a vostè amb el pitjor turment - matar els seus fills i mantenir viva la seva dona. I el que va ser un gran judici del seu Senyor.

trans-unit.source: And We made an appointment with Moses for thirty nights and perfected them by [the addition of] ten; so the term of his Lord was completed as forty nights. And Moses said to his brother Aaron, "Take my place among my people, do right [by them], and do not follow the way of the corrupters."
trans-unit.target: I vam fer una cita amb Moses trenta nits i perfeccionar-los afegint [] deu; Així es va acabar el termini del seu Senyor com quaranta nits. I Moses va dir al seu germà Aaron, "assec entre la meva gent, fer costat [de] i no segueixen el camí de la corrupters."

trans-unit.source: And when Moses arrived at Our appointed time and his Lord spoke to him, he said, "My Lord, show me [Yourself] that I may look at You." [Allah] said, "You will not see Me, but look at the mountain; if it should remain in place, then you will see Me." But when his Lord appeared to the mountain, He rendered it level, and Moses fell unconscious. And when he awoke, he said, "Exalted are You! I have repented to You, and I am the first of the believers."
trans-unit.target: I quan Moses va arribar al nostre temps assenyalat i el Senyor va parlar a ell, va dir, "El meu Senyor, Mostra'm [t] que pot mirar-te." [Allah] va dir: "vostè no em veuran, però mira la muntanya; Si hauria de romandre en el lloc, llavors vostè veurà amb mi." Però quan el seu senyor es va aparèixer a la muntanya, va representar nivell i Moses va caure inconscient. I quan va despertar, va dir, "exaltat és vostè! Jo he penedit a vostè, i jo sóc el primer dels creients."

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "O Moses, I have chosen you over the people with My messages and My words [to you]. So take what I have given you and be among the grateful."
trans-unit.target: [Allah] deia, "O Moses, jo t'he escollit a la gent amb els meus missatges i les meves paraules [te]. Així prendre el que us he donat i entre la agraïts."

trans-unit.source: And We wrote for him on the tablets [something] of all things - instruction and explanation for all things, [saying], "Take them with determination and order your people to take the best of it. I will show you the home of the defiantly disobedient."
trans-unit.target: I ens va escriure per a ell a les taules [quelcom] de totes les coses - instrucció i explicació de totes les coses, [dir], "agafar-los amb determinació i demanar la seva gent a prendre la millor d'ella. Jo et mostraré la llar de la desafiant desobedient."

trans-unit.source: I will turn away from My signs those who are arrogant upon the earth without right; and if they should see every sign, they will not believe in it. And if they see the way of consciousness, they will not adopt it as a way; but if they see the way of error, they will adopt it as a way. That is because they have denied Our signs and they were heedless of them.
trans-unit.target: Em referiré del meu signes als que són arrogants sobre la terra sense dret; i si que hauria de veure cada senyal, no creuran en ell. I si veuen que la forma de la consciència, no adoptarà-lo com una forma; però si veuen el camí d'error, l'adoptarà com a forma. Allò és perquè ells han negat els nostres signes i eren sense fer cas d'ells.

trans-unit.source: Those who denied Our signs and the meeting of the Hereafter - their deeds have become worthless. Are they recompensed except for what they used to do?
trans-unit.target: Els que negaven rètols i la reunió de la d'ara endavant - els fets s'han convertit en inútils. Són es recompensava excepte el que acostumaven a fer?

trans-unit.source: And the people of Moses made, after [his departure], from their ornaments a calf - an image having a lowing sound. Did they not see that it could neither speak to them nor guide them to a way? They took it [for worship], and they were wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: I la gent de Moses, després [la seva sortida], seus adorns un vedell - una imatge tenint al so. No ho veuen que ho podia ni parlar-los ni guiar-los a una forma? Van prendre [per al culte], i eren malfactors.

trans-unit.source: And when regret overcame them and they saw that they had gone astray, they said, "If our Lord does not have mercy upon us and forgive us, we will surely be among the losers."
trans-unit.target: I quan tot va superar-los i van veure que haguessin sortit per mal camí, va dir, "Si nostre Senyor no tingui pietat sobre nosaltres i ens perdona, que segurament serà entre els perdedors".

trans-unit.source: And when Moses returned to his people, angry and grieved, he said, "How wretched is that by which you have replaced me after [my departure]. Were you impatient over the matter of your Lord?" And he threw down the tablets and seized his brother by [the hair of] his head, pulling him toward him. [Aaron] said, "O son of my mother, indeed the people oppressed me and were about to kill me, so let not the enemies rejoice over me and do not place me among the wrongdoing people."
trans-unit.target: I quan Moses va tornar al seu poble, enfadats i afligit, va dir, "miserable com és que pel qual reemplaçar m després de [meu sortida]. Era impacient sobre l'assumpte del seu senyor?" I va llançar els comprimits i haguessin agafat el seu germà per [el cabell de] seu cap, estirant-lo cap a ell. [Aaron] va dir, "fill O de la meva mare, de fet la gent m'oprimeixen i estaven a punt de matar-me, així que no els enemics s'alegrin em i no situar-me entre la gent d'irregularitats."

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "My Lord, forgive me and my brother and admit us into Your mercy, for You are the most merciful of the merciful."
trans-unit.target: [Moses] va dir: "Senyor, perdonar em i el meu germà i ens admeti a la seva Mercè, ets la més misericordiós de les almoines".

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who took the calf [for worship] will obtain anger from their Lord and humiliation in the life of this world, and thus do We recompense the inventors [of falsehood].
trans-unit.target: De fet, els que van prendre el vedell [per al culte] obtindran la ira del seu Senyor i humiliació en la vida d'aquest món, i així ens recompensa els inventors [de falsedat].

trans-unit.source: But those who committed misdeeds and then repented after them and believed - indeed your Lord, thereafter, is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Però qui comès malifetes i llavors penedit després d'ells i creu - a partir de llavors, de fet el seu Senyor, és indulgent i Clement.

trans-unit.source: And when the anger subsided in Moses, he took up the tablets; and in their inscription was guidance and mercy for those who are fearful of their Lord.
trans-unit.target: I quan la ira disminuït en Moses, ell va prendre els comprimits; i en la seva inscripció era orientació i Misericòrdia per a aquells que tenen por del seu Senyor.

trans-unit.source: And Moses chose from his people seventy men for Our appointment. And when the earthquake seized them, he said, "My Lord, if You had willed, You could have destroyed them before and me [as well]. Would You destroy us for what the foolish among us have done? This is not but Your trial by which You send astray whom You will and guide whom You will. You are our Protector, so forgive us and have mercy upon us; and You are the best of forgivers.
trans-unit.target: I Moses va triar de la seva gent de setanta homes per a la nostra cita. I quan el terratrèmol agafat, va dir, "Senyor, si vostè tenia willed, has pogut destruït abans i jo [també]. Ens vols destruir per a què els ximples entre nosaltres han fet? Això no és sinó el seu judici pel qual enviar per mal camí qui es i guia qui es. Ets nostre Protector, així perdonar-nos i tenir pietat sobre nosaltres; i ets el millor de forgivers.

trans-unit.source: And decree for us in this world [that which is] good and [also] in the Hereafter; indeed, we have turned back to You." [Allah] said, "My punishment - I afflict with it whom I will, but My mercy encompasses all things." So I will decree it [especially] for those who fear Me and give zakah and those who believe in Our verses -
trans-unit.target: I el decret per a nosaltres en aquest món [que] bo i [també] en el futur; de fet, ens han tornar a vostè." [Allah] deia, "meu càstig - afecten amb això qui ho faré, però la meva Misericòrdia abasta totes les coses." Així es decret [especialment] per a aquells que por de mi i donar-zakah i els que creuen en nostres versos -

trans-unit.source: Those who follow the Messenger, the unlettered prophet, whom they find written in what they have of the Torah and the Gospel, who enjoins upon them what is right and forbids them what is wrong and makes lawful for them the good things and prohibits for them the evil and relieves them of their burden and the shackles which were upon them. So they who have believed in him, honored him, supported him and followed the light which was sent down with him - it is those who will be the successful.
trans-unit.target: Els que segueixen el Missatger, el Profeta inliterat, que troben escrit en el que tenen de la Torà i l'Evangeli, que enjoins a ells el que és correcte i prohibeix què és dolent i fa legal per a ells les coses bones i prohibeix per a ells el mal i alleuja-los de la seva càrrega i els grillons que eren sobre ells. Així que han cregut en ell, li va retre homenatge, donar-li suport i seguir la llum que va ser enviat amb ell - és qui tindrà l'èxit.

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "O mankind, indeed I am the Messenger of Allah to you all, [from Him] to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. There is no deity except Him; He gives life and causes death." So believe in Allah and His Messenger, the unlettered prophet, who believes in Allah and His words, and follow him that you may be guided.
trans-unit.target: Dir, [O Muhammad], "la humanitat O, de fet sóc el Missatger d'Allah a vostè tot, [d'ell] a qui pertany el dominion dels cels i la terra. No hi ha cap Déu excepte ell; Ell dóna vida i causa la mort." Així cregui en Allah i el seu Missatger, el Profeta inliterat, que creu en Allah i les seves paraules, i seguir-lo que et poden guiar.

trans-unit.source: And among the people of Moses is a community which guides by truth and by it establishes justice.
trans-unit.target: I entre la gent de Moses és una comunitat que guies per la veritat i per això s'estableix la justícia.

trans-unit.source: And We divided them into twelve descendant tribes [as distinct] nations. And We inspired to Moses when his people implored him for water, "Strike with your staff the stone," and there gushed forth from it twelve springs. Every people knew its watering place. And We shaded them with clouds and sent down upon them manna and quails, [saying], "Eat from the good things with which We have provided you." And they wronged Us not, but they were [only] wronging themselves.
trans-unit.target: I ells dividida en dotze Nacions tribus descendents [com diferents]. I ens va inspirar a Moses quan seu poble li implorava per l'aigua, "Vaga amb el personal de la pedra," i allà passar endavant-ne dotze fonts. Cada gent sabia el seu lloc de reg. I ells ombrejat amb núvols i enviat a ells mannà i guatlles, [dir], "menjar de les coses bones amb que ens han proporcionat." I no ens van, però ells [només] van wronging-se.

trans-unit.source: And [mention, O Muhammad], when it was said to them, "Dwell in this city and eat from it wherever you will and say, 'Relieve us of our burdens,' and enter the gate bowing humbly; We will [then] forgive you your sins. We will increase the doers of good [in goodness and reward]."
trans-unit.target: I [accèsit, O Muhammad], quan es va dir, "viure en aquesta ciutat i menjar-ne quan sigui que es dir,"Alleujar-nos dels nostres càrregues"i entrar la porta saludant humilment; Nosaltres us [llavors] perdonarà vostres pecats. Ens augmentarà els autors de bons [en bondat i recompensa]."

trans-unit.source: But those who wronged among them changed [the words] to a statement other than that which had been said to them. So We sent upon them a punishment from the sky for the wrong that they were doing.
trans-unit.target: Però aquells que injustament entre ells canviat [les paraules] a una declaració altre que allò que havia dit a ells. Així que hem enviat a ells un càstig del cel pel mal que ho feien.

trans-unit.source: And ask them about the town that was by the sea - when they transgressed in [the matter of] the sabbath - when their fish came to them openly on their sabbath day, and the day they had no sabbath they did not come to them. Thus did We give them trial because they were defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: I preguntar sobre la ciutat que era del mar - quan que transgredien [la matèria de] dissabte - quan els peixos va venir a ells obertament el seu dia de repòs, i el dia que tenien cap dissabte no venia a ells. Així donem judici perquè eren desafiant desobedients.

trans-unit.source: And when a community among them said, "Why do you advise [or warn] a people whom Allah is [about] to destroy or to punish with a severe punishment?" they [the advisors] said, "To be absolved before your Lord and perhaps they may fear Him."
trans-unit.target: I quan una comunitat entre ells va dir: "per què vostè assessorar [o advertir] una quals Allah és gent [sobre] destruir o castigar amb un càstig sever?" que [els assessors] va dir, "a ser Absoltes abans que el seu Senyor i potser ells poden témer-lo."

trans-unit.source: And when they forgot that by which they had been reminded, We saved those who had forbidden evil and seized those who wronged, with a wretched punishment, because they were defiantly disobeying.
trans-unit.target: I quan es van oblidar que els que que havia estat va recordar, hem salvat qui havia prohibit mal i van confiscar qui injustament, amb un càstig miserable, perquè ells van desobeir desafiant.

trans-unit.source: So when they were insolent about that which they had been forbidden, We said to them, "Be apes, despised."
trans-unit.target: Així que quan eren insolent sobre allò que es va prohibir, ens va dir, "Ser simis, menyspreat".

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when your Lord declared that He would surely [continue to] send upon them until the Day of Resurrection those who would afflict them with the worst torment. Indeed, your Lord is swift in penalty; but indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: I [accèsit] Quan el seu Senyor va declarar que tenia sens dubte [continuen] enviar sobre ells fins el dia de resurrecció aquells que afligeixen amb la pitjor turment. De fet, el seu senyor és ràpida en pena; però de fet, és indulgent i Clement.

trans-unit.source: And We divided them throughout the earth into nations. Of them some were righteous, and of them some were otherwise. And We tested them with good [times] and bad that perhaps they would return [to obedience].
trans-unit.target: I podem dividir-los al llarg de la terra en Nacions. D'ells alguns eren justos, i ells alguns van ser altrament. I provem amb bona [temps] i el dolent que potser vols tornar [a l'obediència].

trans-unit.source: And there followed them successors who inherited the Scripture [while] taking the commodities of this lower life and saying, "It will be forgiven for us." And if an offer like it comes to them, they will [again] take it. Was not the covenant of the Scripture taken from them that they would not say about Allah except the truth, and they studied what was in it? And the home of the Hereafter is better for those who fear Allah, so will you not use reason?
trans-unit.target: I va seguir-los seus successors que va heretar l'escriptura [mentre] prenent les mercaderies d'aquesta vida inferior i dient: "Això es ser perdonat per a nosaltres." I si una oferta com això arriba a ells, [nou] tindran-lo. No va ser el Pacte de l'escriptura pres d'ells que vols no diuen sobre Allah excepte la veritat, i va estudiar el ser-hi? I la casa de la d'ara endavant és millor per a aquells que temen Allah, així que no utilitzarà raó?

trans-unit.source: But those who hold fast to the Book and establish prayer - indeed, We will not allow to be lost the reward of the reformers.
trans-unit.target: Però els qui ostentem ràpid al llibre i establir pregària - de fet, no permetrem que es perd la recompensa de reformadors.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when We raised the mountain above them as if it was a dark cloud and they were certain that it would fall upon them, [and Allah said], "Take what We have given you with determination and remember what is in it that you might fear Allah."
trans-unit.target: I [parlar] Quan pugem la muntanya per sobre d'ells com si era un núvol fosc i que estigueren segurs que va caure sobre ells i Allah deia, "prendre el que ens han donat amb determinació i recordar el que hi ha que podrien por Allah."

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when your Lord took from the children of Adam - from their loins - their descendants and made them testify of themselves, [saying to them], "Am I not your Lord?" They said, "Yes, we have testified." [This] - lest you should say on the day of Resurrection, "Indeed, we were of this unaware."
trans-unit.target: I [parlar] Quan el seu Senyor va prendre dels fills d'Adam - des seus lloms - seus descendents i els va fer donar testimoni de si mateixos, [dir], "jo no sóc el seu senyor?" Deien, "Sí, vam tenir va declarar." [Això] - perquè no li hauria de dir el dia de resurrecció, "De fet, ens Desconeixedors això."

trans-unit.source: Or [lest] you say, "It was only that our fathers associated [others in worship] with Allah before, and we were but descendants after them. Then would You destroy us for what the falsifiers have done?"
trans-unit.target: O [no] dius, "va ser només que nostres pares associats [altres en adoració] amb Allah abans, i estàvem però descendents després d'ells. Llavors es destruiria ens pel que han fet els "falsificadors"?"

trans-unit.source: And thus do We [explain in] detail the verses, and perhaps they will return.
trans-unit.target: I així fer [explicar] detallem els versos, i potser tornaran.

trans-unit.source: And recite to them, [O Muhammad], the news of him to whom we gave [knowledge of] Our signs, but he detached himself from them; so Satan pursued him, and he became of the deviators.
trans-unit.target: I recitar-los, [O Muhammad], les notícies d'ell a qui donàvem [coneixement] nostres signes, però va separat ell mateix des d'ells; Així Satanàs perseguint-la, i va esdevenir de la deviators.

trans-unit.source: And if We had willed, we could have elevated him thereby, but he adhered [instead] to the earth and followed his own desire. So his example is like that of the dog: if you chase him, he pants, or if you leave him, he [still] pants. That is the example of the people who denied Our signs. So relate the stories that perhaps they will give thought.
trans-unit.target: I si ens tenia willed, ens podria haver elevat ell així, però ell [lloc] adherides a la terra i seguir el seu propi desig. Pel seu exemple és com allò del gos: si vostè perseguir-lo, ell pantalons o si deixa-li, ell [encara] pantalons. Que és l'exemple dels qui nega rètols. Així es relacionen amb les històries que potser ells et donarà idea.

trans-unit.source: How evil an example [is that of] the people who denied Our signs and used to wrong themselves.
trans-unit.target: Com mal exemple [és] les persones que nega rètols i solia malament ells mateixos.

trans-unit.source: Whoever Allah guides - he is the [rightly] guided; and whoever He sends astray - it is those who are the losers.
trans-unit.target: Qui Allah guia - és el [raó] guiada; i qui va envia per mal camí - és qui són els perdedors.

trans-unit.source: And We have certainly created for Hell many of the jinn and mankind. They have hearts with which they do not understand, they have eyes with which they do not see, and they have ears with which they do not hear. Those are like livestock; rather, they are more astray. It is they who are the heedless.
trans-unit.target: I hem sens dubte creat per a l'infern de la jinn i humanitat. Tenen cors amb els que no entenen, tenen ulls que no veuen, i tenen les orelles que no senten. Aquests són com bestiar; més aviat, que són més per mal camí. Són ells els que són la despreocupats.

trans-unit.source: And to Allah belong the best names, so invoke Him by them. And leave [the company of] those who practice deviation concerning His names. They will be recompensed for what they have been doing.
trans-unit.target: I per Allah pertanyen els millors noms, tan invocar-lo per ells. I deixar [l'empresa de] qui practiquen la desviació sobre els seus noms. Ells es recompensava per el he estat fent.

trans-unit.source: And among those We created is a community which guides by truth and thereby establishes justice.
trans-unit.target: I entre els que vam crear una comunitat que guies per la veritat i així s'estableix a la justícia.

trans-unit.source: But those who deny Our signs - We will progressively lead them [to destruction] from where they do not know.
trans-unit.target: Però aquells que neguen rètols - progressivament els portarà [a destrucció] des d'on no saben.

trans-unit.source: And I will give them time. Indeed, my plan is firm.
trans-unit.target: I vaig a donar-los temps. De fet, el meu pla és ferm.

trans-unit.source: Then do they not give thought? There is in their companion [Muhammad] no madness. He is not but a clear warner.
trans-unit.target: Llavors no es donen pensament? Hi ha a la seva companya [Muhammad] cap bogeria. No és però un Avisador clar.

trans-unit.source: Do they not look into the realm of the heavens and the earth and everything that Allah has created and [think] that perhaps their appointed time has come near? So in what statement hereafter will they believe?
trans-unit.target: Ells no veuen en el Regne dels cels i la terra i tot el que Allah ha creat i [que] que potser els temps assenyalat ha arribat a prop? Així en quina declaració d'ara endavant es creurà?

trans-unit.source: Whoever Allah sends astray - there is no guide for him. And He leaves them in their transgression, wandering blindly.
trans-unit.target: Qui Allah envia per mal camí - hi cap guia per a ell. I els deixa en la seva transgressió, vagant cegament.

trans-unit.source: They ask you, [O Muhammad], about the Hour: when is its arrival? Say, "Its knowledge is only with my Lord. None will reveal its time except Him. It lays heavily upon the heavens and the earth. It will not come upon you except unexpectedly." They ask you as if you are familiar with it. Say, "Its knowledge is only with Allah, but most of the people do not know."
trans-unit.target: Demanen que, [O Muhammad], sobre l'hora: quan és la seva arribada? Dir, "el coneixement és només amb el meu Senyor. Cap revelarà el seu temps excepte ell. Pon fortament en els cels i la terra. No vindrà a vostè excepte inesperadament." Demanen que com si vostè està familiaritzat amb això. Dir, "el coneixement és només amb Allah, però la majoria de la gent no sap."

trans-unit.source: Say, "I hold not for myself [the power of] benefit or harm, except what Allah has willed. And if I knew the unseen, I could have acquired much wealth, and no harm would have touched me. I am not except a warner and a bringer of good tidings to a people who believe."
trans-unit.target: Dir, "vaig mantenir no per mi [el poder de] beneficiar o perjudicar, excepte Allah ha volgut. I si jo sabia invisibles, podria haver adquirit molta riquesa, i gens de mal vols m'han tocat. Jo no sóc excepte un Avisador i un portador de la bona nova a una gent que creu."

trans-unit.source: It is He who created you from one soul and created from it its mate that he might dwell in security with her. And when he covers her, she carries a light burden and continues therein. And when it becomes heavy, they both invoke Allah, their Lord, "If You should give us a good [child], we will surely be among the grateful."
trans-unit.target: És el que t'ha creat d'una ànima i creat a partir de la seva parella que ell podria habitar en seguretat amb ella. I quan es cobreix d'ella, ella porta una càrrega lleugera i continua en el mateix. I quan estigui pesant, tots dos van invocar Allah, seu Senyor, "si cal donar-nos un bon [infantil], segurament estarem entre el agraïts."

trans-unit.source: But when He gives them a good [child], they ascribe partners to Him concerning that which He has given them. Exalted is Allah above what they associate with Him.
trans-unit.target: Però quan li dóna un bon [infantil], atribueixen socis a ell pel que fa a allò que ell ha donat. Exaltat és Allah sobre què estan associats amb ell.

trans-unit.source: Do they associate with Him those who create nothing and they are [themselves] created?
trans-unit.target: Associa amb ell qui crear res i els [mateixos] creada?

trans-unit.source: And the false deities are unable to [give] them help, nor can they help themselves.
trans-unit.target: I les falses divinitats són incapaços de [donar-los ajuda], ni poden ajudar-se.

trans-unit.source: And if you [believers] invite them to guidance, they will not follow you. It is all the same for you whether you invite them or you are silent.
trans-unit.target: I si vostè [creients] convidar-los a l'orientació, no et seguirà. És tot el mateix per a vostè si vostè convidar-los o és muda.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those you [polytheists] call upon besides Allah are servants like you. So call upon them and let them respond to you, if you should be truthful.
trans-unit.target: De fet, els que [politeistes] que apel·la a més d'Allah són criats com tu. Així ells una crida i deixar-los respondre a vostè, si vostè ha de ser veraç.

trans-unit.source: Do they have feet by which they walk? Or do they have hands by which they strike? Or do they have eyes by which they see? Or do they have ears by which they hear? Say, [O Muhammad], "Call your 'partners' and then conspire against me and give me no respite.
trans-unit.target: Tenen peus pel qual caminen? O tenen mans pel qual vaga? O tenen ulls que veuen? O tenen orelles per què senten? Dir, [O Muhammad], "trucar"socis"i llavors conspirar contra mi i donar-me cap respir.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, my protector is Allah, who has sent down the Book; and He is an ally to the righteous.
trans-unit.target: De fet, el meu protector és Allah, que ha enviat el llibre; i ell és un aliat als justos.

trans-unit.source: And those you call upon besides Him are unable to help you, nor can they help themselves."
trans-unit.target: I aquells que invocarà a més ell és incapaços d'ajudar, ni poden ajudar-se."

trans-unit.source: And if you invite them to guidance, they do not hear; and you see them looking at you while they do not see.
trans-unit.target: I si vostè convidar-los a l'orientació, no senten; i els veiem mirant a tu mentre no veus.

trans-unit.source: Take what is given freely, enjoin what is good, and turn away from the ignorant.
trans-unit.target: Prendre el que es dóna lliurement, demanen el que està bé i allunyar els ignorants.

trans-unit.source: And if an evil suggestion comes to you from Satan, then seek refuge in Allah. Indeed, He is Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: I si un mal suggeriment arriba de Satan, llavors buscar refugi en Allah. De fet, ell és sentir i saber.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who fear Allah - when an impulse touches them from Satan, they remember [Him] and at once they have insight.
trans-unit.target: De fet, aquells que temen Allah - quan un impuls ells toca de Satan, recorden [li] i alhora tenen visió.

trans-unit.source: But their brothers - the devils increase them in error; then they do not stop short.
trans-unit.target: Però els seus germans - els diables augmentar-los en l'error; llavors no deixen curt.

trans-unit.source: And when you, [O Muhammad], do not bring them a sign, they say, "Why have you not contrived it?" Say, "I only follow what is revealed to me from my Lord. This [Qur'an] is enlightenment from your Lord and guidance and mercy for a people who believe."
trans-unit.target: I quan vostè, [O Muhammad], no portar-los un signe, diuen, "per què tenen no artificial?" Dir, "només seguir el que es revela a mi del Senyor. Aquest [Qur ' an] és la il luminació del seu Senyor i orientació i Misericòrdia per una gent que creu".

trans-unit.source: So when the Qur'an is recited, then listen to it and pay attention that you may receive mercy.
trans-unit.target: Així que quan el Qur ' an es recita, llavors escoltar-lo i prestar atenció que pot rebre misericòrdia.

trans-unit.source: And remember your Lord within yourself in humility and in fear without being apparent in speech - in the mornings and the evenings. And do not be among the heedless.
trans-unit.target: I recordar el seu Senyor dins de tu mateix en humilitat i por sense ser evident en el discurs - en els matins i les tardes. I no estar entre la sense fer cas.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who are near your Lord are not prevented by arrogance from His worship, and they exalt Him, and to Him they prostrate.
trans-unit.target: De fet, els que estan a prop teu Senyor no s'impedeix per arrogància del seu culte, Canteu-li lloances i li van postrar.

trans-unit.source: They ask you, [O Muhammad], about the bounties [of war]. Say, "The [decision concerning] bounties is for Allah and the Messenger." So fear Allah and amend that which is between you and obey Allah and His Messenger, if you should be believers.
trans-unit.target: Demanen que, [O Muhammad], sobre les bondats [de guerra]. Dir, "la [decisió relativa] recompenses és per a Allah i Missatger." Així por d'Allah i modificar allò que és entre vostè i obeir a Allah i el seu Missatger, si hauria de ser creients.

trans-unit.source: The believers are only those who, when Allah is mentioned, their hearts become fearful, and when His verses are recited to them, it increases them in faith; and upon their Lord they rely -
trans-unit.target: Els creients són només aquells que, quan Allah s'esmenta, seus cors ser temorós, i quan els seus versos són recitats per ells, ells augmenta en fe; i confiar en el seu Senyor-

trans-unit.source: The ones who establish prayer, and from what We have provided them, they spend.
trans-unit.target: Els que s'estableixen l'oració, i de què ens han proporcionat, passen.

trans-unit.source: Those are the believers, truly. For them are degrees [of high position] with their Lord and forgiveness and noble provision.
trans-unit.target: Aquells són els creients, realment. Per a ells són graus [d'alta posició] amb el seu Senyor i el perdó i prestació noble.

trans-unit.source: [It is] just as when your Lord brought you out of your home [for the battle of Badr] in truth, while indeed, a party among the believers were unwilling,
trans-unit.target: [És] igual que quan el seu Senyor portat fora de casa seva [per a la batalla de Badr] en veritat, mentre que en efecte, un partit entre els creients estaven disposats,

trans-unit.source: Arguing with you concerning the truth after it had become clear, as if they were being driven toward death while they were looking on.
trans-unit.target: Discutir amb vostè sobre la veritat, després s'havia convertit en clar, com si es portaven cap a la mort mentre que estaven buscant.

trans-unit.source: [Remember, O believers], when Allah promised you one of the two groups - that it would be yours - and you wished that the unarmed one would be yours. But Allah intended to establish the truth by His words and to eliminate the disbelievers
trans-unit.target: [Recorda, creients O], quan Allah prometia un dels dos grups - que seria seva - i desitjat que aquell desarmat vols ser teu. Però Allah destinada a establir la veritat per les seves paraules i eliminar els disbelievers

trans-unit.source: That He should establish the truth and abolish falsehood, even if the criminals disliked it.
trans-unit.target: Que cal establir la veritat i abolir la falsedat, fins i tot si els criminals no li agradava.

trans-unit.source: [Remember] when you asked help of your Lord, and He answered you, "Indeed, I will reinforce you with a thousand from the angels, following one another."
trans-unit.target: [Recordes] Quan li demana l'ajuda del seu Senyor, i va contestar, "de fet, reforçarà amb un miler d'àngels, seguint un altre."

trans-unit.source: And Allah made it not but good tidings and so that your hearts would be assured thereby. And victory is not but from Allah. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: I Allah feia no però bona nova i per tal que els seus cors estaria assegurada amb això. I la victòria no és sinó des d'Allah. De fet, Allah és exaltat en força i savi.

trans-unit.source: [Remember] when He overwhelmed you with drowsiness [giving] security from Him and sent down upon you from the sky, rain by which to purify you and remove from you the evil [suggestions] of Satan and to make steadfast your hearts and plant firmly thereby your feet.
trans-unit.target: [Recordar] Quan vostè aclaparat amb seguretat somnolència [donar] d'ell i enviat a vostè des del cel, de pluja que purifica i treure de vostè el mal [suggeriments] de Satanàs i a fer ferm el seu cors i fermament així la planta els peus.

trans-unit.source: [Remember] when your Lord inspired to the angels, "I am with you, so strengthen those who have believed. I will cast terror into the hearts of those who disbelieved, so strike [them] upon the necks and strike from them every fingertip."
trans-unit.target: [Recordar] Quan el seu Senyor inspirat als àngels, «jo sóc amb vosaltres, així enfortir aquells que he cregut. Em emesos terror en els cors d'aquells que dubtaven, tan [ells] vaga en el coll i la vaga d'ells cada dits."

trans-unit.source: That is because they opposed Allah and His Messenger. And whoever opposes Allah and His Messenger - indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.
trans-unit.target: Allò és perquè ells s'oposaven a Allah i el seu Missatger. I qui s'oposa a Allah i el seu Missatger - de fet, Allah és greu en pena.

trans-unit.source: "That [is yours], so taste it." And indeed for the disbelievers is the punishment of the Fire.
trans-unit.target: "Que [és teu], així que provar-ho." I de fet pels disbelievers és el càstig del foc.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, when you meet those who disbelieve advancing [for battle], do not turn to them your backs [in flight].
trans-unit.target: O que han cregut, quan coneixes els que dubten avançar [per batalla], no es gira per a ells el seu esquena [en vol].

trans-unit.source: And whoever turns his back to them on such a day, unless swerving [as a strategy] for war or joining [another] company, has certainly returned with anger [upon him] from Allah, and his refuge is Hell - and wretched is the destination.
trans-unit.target: Qui dóna l'esquena a ells en un dia tan, llevat que es desviaven [com a estratègia] per a la guerra o unir-se a l'empresa [un altre], certament ha tornat amb ira [a ell] des d'Allah, i el seu refugi és l'infern - i miserable és el destí.

trans-unit.source: And you did not kill them, but it was Allah who killed them. And you threw not, [O Muhammad], when you threw, but it was Allah who threw that He might test the believers with a good test. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: I no es va fer matar-los, però va ser a Allah qui va matar-los. I vostè va llançar no, [O Muhammad], quan es va llançar, però va ser a Allah que va llançar que ell podria provar els creients amb una bona prova. De fet, Allah és sentir i saber.

trans-unit.source: That [is so], and [also] that Allah will weaken the plot of the disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Que [es-ho], i [també] aquell Allah es debilitaran la trama dels disbelievers.

trans-unit.source: If you [disbelievers] seek the victory - the defeat has come to you. And if you desist [from hostilities], it is best for you; but if you return [to war], We will return, and never will you be availed by your [large] company at all, even if it should increase; and [that is] because Allah is with the believers.
trans-unit.target: Apunteu-vos [disbelievers] la victòria - la derrota ha arribat per a vostè. I si vostè desistir [de les hostilitats], és millor per a vostè; però si tornes [a la guerra], anem a tornar, i mai es vostè ser aprofitat per la teva empresa [gran], encara hauria d'augmentar; i [és] perquè Allah és amb creients.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, obey Allah and His Messenger and do not turn from him while you hear [his order].
trans-unit.target: O es que he cregut, obeir a Allah i el seu Missatger i no girar-se d'ell mentre sents [seu ordre].

trans-unit.source: And do not be like those who say, "We have heard," while they do not hear.
trans-unit.target: I no serà com qui diu, "Hem sentit," mentre que no senten.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the worst of living creatures in the sight of Allah are the deaf and dumb who do not use reason.
trans-unit.target: De fet, el pitjor de la vivents en la vista d'Allah els sords i muts que no fan la raó.

trans-unit.source: Had Allah known any good in them, He would have made them hear. And if He had made them hear, they would [still] have turned away, while they were refusing.
trans-unit.target: Allah hagués sabut bo en ells, li hauria fet escolti. I si ell havia fet sentir, que [encara] hagués convertit en distància, mentre ells van negant.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, respond to Allah and to the Messenger when he calls you to that which gives you life. And know that Allah intervenes between a man and his heart and that to Him you will be gathered.
trans-unit.target: O que han cregut, respondre a Allah i el Missatger quan ell l'anomena al que li dóna vida. I saber que Allah intervé entre un home i el seu cor i que a ell li es recolliran.

trans-unit.source: And fear a trial which will not strike those who have wronged among you exclusively, and know that Allah is severe in penalty.
trans-unit.target: I el temor d'un judici que no atacarà qui han tractat injustament entre vosaltres exclusivament i sap que Allah és greu en pena.

trans-unit.source: And remember when you were few and oppressed in the land, fearing that people might abduct you, but He sheltered you, supported you with His victory, and provided you with good things - that you might be grateful.
trans-unit.target: I recordar quan eres pocs i oprimits de la terra, tement que gent podria segrestar, però va protegida, admet amb la seva victòria i sempre amb les coses bones - que podria estar agraït.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not betray Allah and the Messenger or betray your trusts while you know [the consequence].
trans-unit.target: O que han cregut, no trair Allah i Missatger o trair el seu fideïcomisos mentre que sap [la conseqüència].

trans-unit.source: And know that your properties and your children are but a trial and that Allah has with Him a great reward.
trans-unit.target: I saber que les seves propietats i els seus fills són sinó un judici i que Allah té amb ell una gran recompensa.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, if you fear Allah, He will grant you a criterion and will remove from you your misdeeds and forgive you. And Allah is the possessor of great bounty.
trans-unit.target: O que han cregut, si té por d'Allah, atorga un criteri i voluntat treure de vostè el seu malifetes i et perdoni. I Allah és el posseïdor de grans recompenses.

trans-unit.source: And [remember, O Muhammad], when those who disbelieved plotted against you to restrain you or kill you or evict you [from Makkah]. But they plan, and Allah plans. And Allah is the best of planners.
trans-unit.target: I [recorda, O Muhammad], quan els que dubtaven conspiraren contra frenar o matar o expulsió [de Makkah]. Però planegen i plans d'Allah. I Allah és el millor dels planificadors.

trans-unit.source: And when Our verses are recited to them, they say, "We have heard. If we willed, we could say [something] like this. This is not but legends of the former peoples."
trans-unit.target: I quan els nostres versos els recitats per ells, diuen, "hem sentit. Si hem volgut, podríem dir [quelcom] com aquest. Això no és sinó llegendes dels antics pobles."

trans-unit.source: And [remember] when they said, "O Allah, if this should be the truth from You, then rain down upon us stones from the sky or bring us a painful punishment."
trans-unit.target: I [recorda] quan deien, "Allah O, si això han de ser la veritat de vostè, llavors pluja sobre nosaltres pedres del cel o ens porten un dolor càstig."

trans-unit.source: But Allah would not punish them while you, [O Muhammad], are among them, and Allah would not punish them while they seek forgiveness.
trans-unit.target: Però Allah vols no castigar-los mentre tu, [O Muhammad], es troben entre ells, i Allah vols no castigar-los mentre van demanar perdó.

trans-unit.source: But why should Allah not punish them while they obstruct [people] from al-Masjid al- Haram and they were not [fit to be] its guardians? Its [true] guardians are not but the righteous, but most of them do not know.
trans-unit.target: Però per què hauria Allah no castigar-los mentre que obstrueixen [persones] des d'al al-Masjid-Haram i ells no eren [encaixar ser] seus guardians? Seus guardians [veritables] no són sinó els justos, però la majoria d'ells no saben.

trans-unit.source: And their prayer at the House was not except whistling and handclapping. So taste the punishment for what you disbelieved.
trans-unit.target: I a la casa d'oració no era excepte xiulant i handclapping. Així tastar el càstig per què dubtaven.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who disbelieve spend their wealth to avert [people] from the way of Allah. So they will spend it; then it will be for them a [source of] regret; then they will be overcome. And those who have disbelieved - unto Hell they will be gathered.
trans-unit.target: De fet, els que dubten passar la seva riquesa per evitar [persones] de la manera d'Allah. Així que passen llavors serà per a ells un pesar [font de]; llavors ells serà superada. I els que tenen dubtaven - a l'infern que es recolliran.

trans-unit.source: [This is] so that Allah may distinguish the wicked from the good and place the wicked some of them upon others and heap them all together and put them into Hell. It is those who are the losers.
trans-unit.target: [És] perquè Allah poden distingir els mals del bé i posar els mals alguns d'ells en altres i heap-los tots junts i posar-los en l'infern. És qui són els perdedors.

trans-unit.source: Say to those who have disbelieved [that] if they cease, what has previously occurred will be forgiven for them. But if they return [to hostility] - then the precedent of the former [rebellious] peoples has already taken place.
trans-unit.target: Dir a aquells que tenen dubtaven [que] Si deixen, què s'ha prèviament produït es ser perdonats per ells. Però si tornen [a l'hostilitat] - llavors el precedent dels antics pobles [rebels] ja realitzada.

trans-unit.source: And fight them until there is no fitnah and [until] the religion, all of it, is for Allah. And if they cease - then indeed, Allah is Seeing of what they do.
trans-unit.target: I lluitar contra ells fins que hi hagi cap fitnah i [fins] a la religió, tot això, és per a Allah. I si deixen - de fet, llavors Allah és veure de què fan.

trans-unit.source: But if they turn away - then know that Allah is your protector. Excellent is the protector, and Excellent is the helper.
trans-unit.target: Però si s'allunyen - llavors sap que Allah és el protector. Excel·lent és el protector i excel·lent és l'ajudant.

trans-unit.source: And know that anything you obtain of war booty - then indeed, for Allah is one fifth of it and for the Messenger and for [his] near relatives and the orphans, the needy, and the [stranded] traveler, if you have believed in Allah and in that which We sent down to Our Servant on the day of criterion - the day when the two armies met. And Allah, over all things, is competent.
trans-unit.target: I saber que res que disposicion de botí de guerra - aleshores, de fet, per Allah és una cinquena part d'ella i pel Missatger i per la [seva] a prop parents i els orfes, els més necessitats i el viatger [encallats], si s'han cregut en Allah i en allò que hem enviat al nostre servent del dia del criteri - el dia quan els dos exèrcits es van reunir. I Allah, sobre totes les coses, és competent.

trans-unit.source: [Remember] when you were on the near side of the valley, and they were on the farther side, and the caravan was lower [in position] than you. If you had made an appointment [to meet], you would have missed the appointment. But [it was] so that Allah might accomplish a matter already destined - that those who perished [through disbelief] would perish upon evidence and those who lived [in faith] would live upon evidence; and indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: [Recordar] Quan tenies al costat de la vall, a prop i van ser en el costat més lluny, i la caravana estava inferior [en posició] que tu. Si havia fet una cita [davant], vostè hauria perdut el nomenament. Però [era] perquè Allah podria aconseguir una qüestió ja destinat - que qui van morir [a través d'incredulitat] vols morir en evidències i qui vivien [en fe] vols viure en proves; i en efecte, Allah és sentir i saber.

trans-unit.source: [Remember, O Muhammad], when Allah showed them to you in your dream as few; and if He had shown them to you as many, you [believers] would have lost courage and would have disputed in the matter [of whether to fight], but Allah saved [you from that]. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
trans-unit.target: [Recorda, O Muhammad], quan Allah va mostrar-los a vostè en el seu somni com pocs; i si ell havia mostrat-los a vostè com molts, que [creients] hauria perdut coratge i vols disputat en la matèria [de si combatre], però Allah [et des que] va salvar. De fet, és saber que dins els pits.

trans-unit.source: And [remember] when He showed them to you, when you met, as few in your eyes, and He made you [appear] as few in their eyes so that Allah might accomplish a matter already destined. And to Allah are [all] matters returned.
trans-unit.target: I [recorda] Quan va mostrar-los a vostè, quan va conèixer, tan sols en els seus ulls, i va fer [aparèixer] tan sols en els seus ulls que Allah podria aconseguir una qüestió ja destinat. I per Allah es retornen matèries [tots els].

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, when you encounter a company [from the enemy forces], stand firm and remember Allah much that you may be successful.
trans-unit.target: O es que he cregut, quan trobeu una empresa [de les forces enemigues], ferm i recordar Allah molt que vostè tingui èxit.

trans-unit.source: And obey Allah and His Messenger, and do not dispute and [thus] lose courage and [then] your strength would depart; and be patient. Indeed, Allah is with the patient.
trans-unit.target: I obeir a Allah i el seu Missatger i no [així] perdre el coratge i [llavors] Forces sortiria; i ser pacient. De fet, Allah és amb el pacient.

trans-unit.source: And do not be like those who came forth from their homes insolently and to be seen by people and avert [them] from the way of Allah. And Allah is encompassing of what they do.
trans-unit.target: I no ser com els que va sortir de casa seva amb insolència i per ser vist per habitar i evitar [ells] de la manera d'Allah. I Allah és que abasta de què fan.

trans-unit.source: And [remember] when Satan made their deeds pleasing to them and said, "No one can overcome you today from among the people, and indeed, I am your protector." But when the two armies sighted each other, he turned on his heels and said, "Indeed, I am disassociated from you. Indeed, I see what you do not see; indeed I fear Allah. And Allah is severe in penalty."
trans-unit.target: I [recorda] Quan Satanàs va fer seus actes agradable a ells i els va dir, "ningú pot superar avui des del poble, i de fet, jo sóc el seu protector". Però quan els dos exèrcits miop mútuament, engegat els talons i deia, "de fet, jo sóc dissociades de vostè. De fet, veig que no veieu; de fet em temo Allah. I Allah és greu en pena".

trans-unit.source: [Remember] when the hypocrites and those in whose hearts was disease said, "Their religion has deluded those [Muslims]." But whoever relies upon Allah - then indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: [Recordar] Quan els hipòcrites i aquells als cors del qual era la malaltia va dir, "seva religió ha enganyat aquells [musulmans]." Però qui es basa en Allah - llavors fet, Allah és exaltat en força i savi.

trans-unit.source: And if you could but see when the angels take the souls of those who disbelieved... They are striking their faces and their backs and [saying], "Taste the punishment of the Burning Fire.
trans-unit.target: I si li però poder veure quan els àngels prendre les ànimes d'aquells que dubtaven... Ells són sorprenents els rostres i l'esquena i [dir], "tastar el càstig del foc cremant.

trans-unit.source: That is for what your hands have put forth [of evil] and because Allah is not ever unjust to His servants."
trans-unit.target: Allò és per què han de posar les mans endavant [del mal] i perquè Allah no és mai injust als seus servents. "

trans-unit.source: [Theirs is] like the custom of the people of Pharaoh and of those before them. They disbelieved in the signs of Allah, so Allah seized them for their sins. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and severe in penalty.
trans-unit.target: [Ells és] com el costum de la gent del faraó i de les persones davant d'ells. Ells dubtaven en els senyals d'Allah, perquè Allah agafat pels seus pecats. De fet, Allah és potent i severa en pena.

trans-unit.source: That is because Allah would not change a favor which He had bestowed upon a people until they change what is within themselves. And indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Allò és perquè Allah no canviaria un favor que ell havia atorgat a un poble fins que van canviar el que és dins de si mateixos. I en efecte, Allah és sentir i saber.

trans-unit.source: [Theirs is] like the custom of the people of Pharaoh and of those before them. They denied the signs of their Lord, so We destroyed them for their sins, and We drowned the people of Pharaoh. And all [of them] were wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: [Ells és] com el costum de la gent del faraó i de les persones davant d'ells. Van negar els senyals del seu Senyor, així hem destruït pels seus pecats, i es va ofegar la gent del faraó. I tots [ells] eren malfactors.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the worst of living creatures in the sight of Allah are those who have disbelieved, and they will not [ever] believe -
trans-unit.target: De fet, el pitjor de la vivents en la vista d'Allah són els que dubtaven tenen i no ho faran creure [sempre] -

trans-unit.source: The ones with whom you made a treaty but then they break their pledge every time, and they do not fear Allah.
trans-unit.target: Aquells amb qui es va signar un tractat però llavors van trencar la seva promesa cada vegada, i no tenen por de Allah.

trans-unit.source: So if you, [O Muhammad], gain dominance over them in war, disperse by [means of] them those behind them that perhaps they will be reminded.
trans-unit.target: Així que si vostè, [O Muhammad], guanyar dominació sobre ells en guerra, mitjançant [de] dispersar-los aquells darrere d'ells que potser ells es recordar.

trans-unit.source: If you [have reason to] fear from a people betrayal, throw [their treaty] back to them, [putting you] on equal terms. Indeed, Allah does not like traitors.
trans-unit.target: Si vostè [té raó] por d'una traïció de la gent, llançar [seu tractat] nou a ells, [que li posa] en igualtat de condicions. De fet, Allah no li agraden els traïdors.

trans-unit.source: And let not those who disbelieve think they will escape. Indeed, they will not cause failure [to Allah].
trans-unit.target: I que no els que dubten pensar que s'escaparà. De fet, no provocaran error [a Allah].

trans-unit.source: And prepare against them whatever you are able of power and of steeds of war by which you may terrify the enemy of Allah and your enemy and others besides them whom you do not know [but] whom Allah knows. And whatever you spend in the cause of Allah will be fully repaid to you, and you will not be wronged.
trans-unit.target: I preparar contra ells tot el són capaços de poder i de cavalls de guerra pel qual vostè pot aterrorizará l'enemic d'Allah i el seu enemic i altres a més d'ells qui no saps [però] qui sap Allah. I tot el que passa en la causa d'Allah es totalment retornarà a vostè, i vostè no ser injustament.

trans-unit.source: And if they incline to peace, then incline to it [also] and rely upon Allah. Indeed, it is He who is the Hearing, the Knowing.
trans-unit.target: I si van inclinar a Pau, llavors inclinem a ella [també] i confiar en Allah. De fet, és el que està en l'audiència, el saber.

trans-unit.source: But if they intend to deceive you - then sufficient for you is Allah. It is He who supported you with His help and with the believers
trans-unit.target: Però si es pretén enganyar-llavors prou és Allah. És ell qui et dóna suport amb la seva ajuda i amb els creients

trans-unit.source: And brought together their hearts. If you had spent all that is in the earth, you could not have brought their hearts together; but Allah brought them together. Indeed, He is Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: I va reunir els seus cors. Si havia passat tot el que és a la terra, vostè podria no haver portat seus cors junts; però Allah va reunir. De fet, ell és exaltat en força i savi.

trans-unit.source: O Prophet, sufficient for you is Allah and for whoever follows you of the believers.
trans-unit.target: O profeta, prou és Allah i per a qui et segueix dels creients.

trans-unit.source: O Prophet, urge the believers to battle. If there are among you twenty [who are] steadfast, they will overcome two hundred. And if there are among you one hundred [who are] steadfast, they will overcome a thousand of those who have disbelieved because they are a people who do not understand.
trans-unit.target: O profeta, instar els creients a la batalla. Si hi ha entre vosaltres vint [que són] ferm, superarà dos-cents. I si hi ha entre vosaltres cent [que són] ferm, superarà un miler d'aquells que tenen dubtaven perquè són una gent que no entén.

trans-unit.source: Now, Allah has lightened [the hardship] for you, and He knows that among you is weakness. So if there are from you one hundred [who are] steadfast, they will overcome two hundred. And if there are among you a thousand, they will overcome two thousand by permission of Allah. And Allah is with the steadfast.
trans-unit.target: Ara, Allah ha alleugerit [les dificultats] per a vostè, i sap que entre vosaltres és feblesa. Així que si hi ha de vostè cent [que són] ferm, superarà dos-cents. I si hi ha entre vosaltres mil, superarà dos mil amb permís d'Allah. I Allah és amb el ferm.

trans-unit.source: It is not for a prophet to have captives [of war] until he inflicts a massacre [upon Allah 's enemies] in the land. Some Muslims desire the commodities of this world, but Allah desires [for you] the Hereafter. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: No és per un profeta que captius [de guerra] fins que infligeix una massacre [en enemics de Allah] a la terra. Alguns musulmans desig les mercaderies d'aquest món, però Allah desitjos [perquè] el més enllà. I Allah és exaltat en força i savi.

trans-unit.source: If not for a decree from Allah that preceded, you would have been touched for what you took by a great punishment.
trans-unit.target: Si no és per un decret d'Allah que van precedir, hauria estat tocat pel que vostè va prendre per un gran càstig.

trans-unit.source: So consume what you have taken of war booty [as being] lawful and good, and fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Així consumir el que vostè ha pres de botí de guerra [com] legal i bona i por d'Allah. En efecte, Allah és indulgent i Clement.

trans-unit.source: O Prophet, say to whoever is in your hands of the captives, "If Allah knows [any] good in your hearts, He will give you [something] better than what was taken from you, and He will forgive you; and Allah is Forgiving and Merciful."
